Corpus: One-million Corpus of Croatian Literary Language
Description: The corpus is listed in the LINDAT repository.
This corpus presents the collected works of the Danish author Johannes Jensen.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from CLARIN-DK and for online browsing through a dedicated concordancer.
This corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.

Corpus: York-Helsinki Parsed Corpus of Old English Poetry
Description: This corpus contains a selection of poetic texts (71,490 words) from the Old English Section of the Helsinki Corpus of English Texts.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the Oxford Text Archive.

Corpus: Collection of older original Estonian-language works of fiction
Description: This corpus collects older Estonian literary texts published on "Kreutzwald's Century: the Estonian Cultural History Web". The electronically republished books, included in the collection, are based on the first editions of works by more important Estonian authors, published in 1854-1944.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.
This corpus contains texts from 1990 onwards.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from CELR.

These are the oldest text recordings of Estonian runic songs (the text recordings were created in the 19th century and in the first decades of the 20th century). In addition to the runic songs, the database also has songs of transitional form and end-rhymed songs (about 6000).#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.

Corpus: Classics of English and American Literature in Finnish (CEAL)
Description: This corpus contains Finnish translations of the following three texts: Jane Austen: Ylpeys ja ennakkoluulo (Pride and Prejudice), translated by Kersti Juva, Teos 2013; Henry James: Washingtonin aukio (Washington Square), translated by Kersti Juva, Otava 2003; Charles Dickens: Kolea talo (Bleak House), translated by Kersti Juva, Tammi, 2006.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through Korp in two versions - Version 1 (Sentences and Paragraphs in the Original Order) and Version 2 (Scrambled Paragraphs))

Corpus: Classics of Finnish Literature, Kielipankki Version
Description: This corpus contains prose fiction, plays, poetry and aphorisms (some written originally in Swedish) of established Finnish authors published from 1880s to 1949.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through Korp.
This corpus contains samples of Finnish literature published by the WSOY publishing company in the 1990.#SEPThe corpus is available online through FIN-CLARIN.

This corpus contains various works published during the Swedish rule (from the 16th century to about 1810), extensive manuscripts from that period (most of which were later printed), as well as individual almanac and decree texts, sermons and poetry.#SEPThis corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.

This corpus contains works by established Finnish fiction writers from the 1880s to the 1930s. There are different types of prose and plays, as well as lyrics and aphorisms.#SEPThis corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.
This corpus contains Finnish books made available by the Gutenberg project. The texts have not been linguistically annotated.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through Korp.

Corpus: The Morpho-Syntactic Database of Mikael Agricola's Works
Description: This corpus contains the Finnish parts of Mikael Agricola’s works (Abckiria, Rukouskiria, Se Wsi testamenti, Käsikiria, Messu, Piina, Psaltari, Veisut, Profeetat).#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through Korp.

This corpus contains République-Bastille, a novel by Melpo Axioti. This French text is of particular linguistic interest since it is a text written in a language other than the author's mother tongue and is suited for research on bilingualism and self-translation. It would be worth measuring the naturalness of the language with computational tools, for example.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from clarin:el.

This corpus contains medieval texts contains written material covering the period from the 4th till the 16th century A.D. The texts can be classified into the following categories: religious, poetical-literary, political-historical, hymns, epigrams.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from clarin:el.
This corpus presents classics from the end of the 19th century to the beginning of the 20th century.
This corpus contains Kerttu Vuolab's novel Cheppari cháráhus.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the TAITO shell.
This corpus, which is based on OCR data from the National Library of Norway, is available for online browsing through INESS.

Corpus: NorGramBank children’s fiction in Norwegian Bokmål
Description: This corpus, which is based on OCR data from the National Library of Norway, is available for online browsing through INESS.

Corpus: NorGrambank children's fiction in Norwegian Nynorsk
Description: This corpus, which is based on OCR data from the National Library of Norway, is available for online browsing through INESS.
This corpus, which is based on OCR data from the National Library of Norway, is available for online browsing through INESS.
This corpus is available for download from CLARIN-PL.
This corpus is available for download from CLARIN-PL.
This corpus is available for download from CLARIN-PL.

Corpus: POE: Microcorpus of 20th century Polish poetry
Description: This corpus is available for download from CLARIN-PL.
This corpus contains 70 copyright-free classics (61 Portugal and 9 Brazil) published before 1940.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from PORTULAN.

Corpus: Banco de Datos de Once Novelas Españolas 1951—1971 (SOL) (2014-10-08)
Description: This corpus is available for download from SWE-CLARIN and for online browsing through Korp.

Corpus: Electronic corpus of 15th-century Castilian cancionero manuscripts
Description: This is a lyric corpus of 15th century cancioneros.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.

Corpus: Electronic text corpus of Sumerian literature (ETCSL)
Description: This corpus presents a selection of nearly 400 literary compositions recorded on sources which come from ancient Mesopotamia and date to the late third and early second millennia BCE.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through an external interface.
This corpus presents the collected works of August Strindberg.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from SWE-CLARIN and for online browsing through Korp.
This corpus presents 69 Bonnier novels from 1976-77.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from SWE-CLARIN and for online browsing through Korp.
This corpus presents 60 Bonnier novels from 1980-81.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from SWE-CLARIN and for online browsing through Korp.
